newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland, May 8.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Ireland, May 8.

text.p: The following are the highlights of stories from the Irish press on Thursday:
IRISH TIMES
- Poll reverse leaves Rainbow Coalition 12 points behind Fianna Fail and the Progressive Democrats.
- Bruton urges IRA to "throw away for good crutch of violence"
- World snooker champion Ken Doherty arrives in Dublin
- Export of live cattle to Egypt to resume following talks
- Urgent talks under way to save 320 jobs at Asahi plant in County Mayo
- President Mobutu of Zaire flies to Gabon to attend African regional conference as fighting continues in Zaire
- ESRI institute calls for higher road tax
- Orangemen discuss use of mediation for contentious marches
- Avonmore makes biggest-ever buy with 54.2 million stg deal for Beni Foods
- CRH profits to drop slightly in first half
- AIB raises home loan rate
- Grafton makes two investment forays into British firms
- Union condemns Ryanair bonuses
IRISH INDEPENDENT
- Tax shake-up plan targets 1,000 new jobs a week
- Poll plans in chaos as Fine Gael vote slumps
- Probe as four die in horror crash in County Limerick
- World snooker champion Ken Doherty returns
- TV viewers set for 70 digital channels
- AIB raises home loans
- Criminal cash to fund drive against drugs
- Health minister Michael Noonan faces new attack on hepatitis "pressure"
- Loyalist chief warns Mowlam on Sinn Fein meeting
- Agriculture minister Ivan Yates in deal to re-start cattle exports to Egypt
- Bruton seeks date for Sinn Fein talks entry from Blair
- Currency markets take a breather
- Ryanair chief O'Leary's 17 million stg bonus tops executive league
- Ireland lags in spend on research and development
- Irish businesses more confident about future
- CRH warns of first-half profits decline
THE EXAMINER
- Mother and child killed in road carnage horror
- Central Bank pays up to one billion pounds to defend the punt
- Bruton and Blair to begin renewed push for peace at today's meeting
- Cattle exports to Egypt will resume shortly
- Dairy farmers may suffer 30 percent income slump
- Anger at refusal to reveal hepatitis C legal strategy
- Poll blow as Fine Gael support falls ahead of election
- Mobutu leaves Kinshasa amid speculation he won't return
- Avonmore to buy 10 percent of meat firm
- Ireland forecast to qualify for EMU
- Irish stock market to benefit as Ryanair's public flotation takes off
